required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound vs. Auscultation for Optimal Depth of the Cuffless RAE Tube
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound-guidance Versus Auscultation to Confirm Optimal Insertion Depth of the Cuffless Oral Ring-Adair-Elwyn (RAE) Endotracheal Tube in Pediatric Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the ultrasound-guidance versus auscultation to confirm optimal insertion depth of the cuffless oral Ring-Adair-Elwyn (RAE) endotracheal tube in pediatric patients undergoing general anesthesia.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of optimal location of the cuffless Oral RAE tube (%)
primary_outcome.time_frame: during operation (until endotracheal extubation) up to 18 hour after induction
primary_outcome.description: The distance between the tip of cuffless RAE tube and right pulmonary artery is within the -5mm ~ +5mm value of the distance between the T2 mid-vertebra and carina (optimal depth)

secondary_outcome.measure: M-distance (between the carina and the T2 mid-vertebra)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during operation up to 18 hour after induction
secondary_outcome.description: The distance between T2 mid-vertebra and the carina)

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance between the optimal depth and the relocated depth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during operation up to 18 hour after induction
secondary_outcome.description: Distance between the optimal depth and the relocated depth

secondary_outcome.measure: Subglottic diameter at the cricoid cartilage level
secondary_outcome.description: Subglottic diameter at the cricoid cartilage level using neck US

secondary_outcome.measure: ID and OD of optimal cuffless oral RAE tube
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during operation up to 18 hour after induction
secondary_outcome.description: Internal and external diameter of optimal cuffless oral RAE tube

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from intubation to confirming the tube depth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during operation up to 18 hour after induction
secondary_outcome.description: Time from intubation to confirming the tube depth (seconds)

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance between the optimal depth and the manufacturer's recommended depth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during operation up to 18 hour after induction
secondary_outcome.description: Distance between the optimal depth and the manufacturer's recommended depth

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during operation up to 18 hour after induction
secondary_outcome.description: Airway leakage pressure measured by manual ventilation with APL(Adjustable pressure-limiting) valve

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the intraoperative airway-related events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during operation up to 18 hour after induction
secondary_outcome.description: accidental extubation, endobronchial intubation, desaturation (SpO2 < 95%), etc

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the airway-related symptoms after extubation
secondary_outcome.description: hoarseness, stridor, laryngospasm, chest retraction, etc

arm_group.description: Ultrasound-guided detection of endobronchial intubation depth by loss of lung sliding sign in the left lung field
Auscultation-guided detection of endobronchial intubation depth by loss of breathing sound in the left lung field

intervention.intervention_name: Ultrasound-guided determination of cuffless RAE tube depth
intervention.description: Measurement of "Carina-T2 mid-vertebra length" from preoperative Cheat PA Ultrasound-guided detection of endobronchial intubation depth by loss of lung sliding sign in the left lung field. Withdrawal of the cuffless RAE tube using the "Carina-T2 mid-vertebra length" for optimal positioning

intervention.intervention_name: Auscultation-guided determination of cuffless RAE tube depth
intervention.description: Measurement of "Carina-T2 mid-vertebra length" from preoperative Cheat PA Auscultation-guided detection of endobronchial intubation depth by loss of breathing sound in the left lung field Withdrawal of the cuffless RAE tube using the "Carina-T2 mid-vertebra length" for optimal positioning

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children age under 7 years
- Undergoing general anesthesia
- Endobronchial intubation with cuffless oral RAE tube
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pulmonary disease
- Active upper respiratory tract infection
- History of upper or lower respiratory tract infection within 2 weeks
- Emergent operation
- Unstable vital sign

reference.citation: Altun D, Orhan-Sungur M, Ali A, Özkan-Seyhan T, Sivrikoz N, Çamcı E. The role of ultrasound in appropriate endotracheal tube size selection in pediatric patients. Paediatr Anaesth. 2017 Oct;27(10):1015-1020. doi: 10.1111/pan.13220. Epub 2017 Aug 28.

Ahn JH, Kwon E, Lee SY, Hahm TS, Jeong JS. Ultrasound-guided lung sliding sign to confirm optimal depth of tracheal tube insertion in young children. Br J Anaesth. 2019 Sep;123(3):309-315. doi: 10.1016/j.bja.2019.03.020. Epub 2019 Apr 12.
